neighborhood_overview:
SÃ£o Conrado District Attractions

Among the natural beauty attractions of the neighborhood are Praia de SÃ£o Conrado with the beautiful view of the sea and some archipelagos, Pedra da GÃ¡vea, surrounding mountains and Av. Niemeyer, which connects SÃ£o Conrado to the Leblon district, with a lush sea view.


The GÃ¡vea Golf Club is located in an area near the sea, acquired in 1921 by the heirs of Ferreira Viana, aristocrats admirers of this sport.

The Free Flight Club is located on the edge of Praia de SÃ£o Conrado, where the double wing and paragliding flights that land in the same location are scheduled. It is also very pleasant to see the pilots hover and fly over the sea and around the rock of Pedra da GÃ¡vea, and then land gently on the beach. The landings are made in the sandy strip that faces a playground, at the end of Praia de SÃ£o Conrado.

Wing-delta and paragliding flights depart from Pedra Bonita, very close to Pedra da GÃ¡vea.

description: Perfect location between Copacabana and Ipanema, just 3 minutes from Copacabana Beach (Post 6) and 12 minutes from Ipanema Beach. neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Copacabana has the most beautiful sunrise.  Copacabana is known for its variety and availability of services and commerce. You can find a great diversity of restaurants serving cuisines from various parts of the world, such as Japanese, Arabic, Italian, and typical Brazilian dishes for kilo or not. In addition, the neighborhood is famous for its vibrant commerce, with shops that sell everything from clothing and electronics to handmade products. It is a place that never really sleeps, offering options for all needs and tastes at any time of the day or night.

neighborhood_overview: Copacabana, located in the south of Rio de Janeiro, is an iconic and vibrant neighborhood that stretches along the famous Copacabana beach. Known for its lively atmosphere, the neighborhood offers a unique blend of culture, leisure, and natural beauties. The beachfront avenue, with its busy boardwalk, is the scene of diverse activities, from sports practices to artistic performances. In addition, Copacabana is home to a variety of restaurants, bars, shops and hotels, making it a popular tourist destination. With its white sand beach, Sugarloaf Mountain as a backdrop and the stunning ocean view, Copacabana captivates both residents and visitors, providing an authentically carioca experience.
host_about:

We have been traveling the world together and after spending a lot of time in different accommodations in different countries, we decided it would be our turn to host guests and travelers. To provide comfort and ensure you have a great time. To make you discover what we love so much about the carioca lifestyle :) 

Cheers amigos!

neighborhood_overview: Ipanema is an upscale neighborhood in Rio de Janeiro known for its famous beach, with a busy promenade full of kiosks and bars, as well as being surrounded by many restaurants, shops and art galleries. The building is located on one of the neighborhood's main avenues, Avenida Vieira Souto, in front of Ipanema beach. Guests can walk along the promenade or relax on the beach sand, as well as visit the Arpoador viewpoint to enjoy the sunset views. The region is quite busy during the day, making it ideal for sporting activities such as surfing, racquetball and footvolley. The neighborhood offers several cultural options, such as the Casa de Cultura Laura Alvim and the Galeria de Arte Ipanema. It is also possible to visit Lagoa Rodrigo de Freitas, which is just a few minutes away, or visit the Ipanema Hippie Fair, which takes place on Sundays at PraÃ§a General OsÃ³rio, with many handicraft and souvenir options. neighborhood_overview:
Copacabana is a noble neighborhood located in the South Zone of the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is considered one of the most famous and prestigious neighborhoods in Brazil and one of the best known in the world. It has the nickname of Princess of the Sea and Heart of the South Zone. It also borders the noble neighborhoods of Lagoa, Ipanema, Botafogo, Leme and HumaitÃ¡. In terms of population, it is the most populous neighborhood in the South Zone of the Rio capital, with more than 140,000 inhabitants in 2010, of which about 1/3 (about 43,000 inhabitants[5] in 2010) is made up of the elderly, aged sixty and over. In fact, Copacabana is sometimes pointed out as âthe neighborhood with the oldest populationâ in the country.

name: (1306) 2 Suites 150 Meters from Leblon Beach with
description: The apartment accommodates up to 6 people in comfort in its two suites with king size beds, full kitchen and living room with sofa bed. On the balcony, a breathtaking view of Christ the Redeemer. It also has a washing machine and air conditioning in every room. The building offers 24-hour security and is close to several options of restaurants, bars and designer stores. Ideal for families and groups of friends in search of comfort and sophistication.
neighborhood_overview: The Leblon neighborhood is one of the most charming and sophisticated in the city of Rio de Janeiro. The region is known for its paradisiacal beaches, fine-dining restaurants, bars, cafes and designer stores. The surroundings of the accommodation offer various leisure and entertainment options. One suggestion is to walk along the famous Leblon beach promenade and enjoy the most beautiful sunset in the city. Another option is to visit the Botanical Garden, one of the most beautiful tourist attractions in Rio de Janeiro. For those who like shopping, Shopping Leblon is an excellent option. The place has several national and international brand stores, as well as a large food court. The neighborhood is also known for its vibrant nightlife. The beach, 2 km long, from Arpoador to Jardim de Alah, is a meeting point for young residents and enchanted tourists, especially close to post 9. The beach is used to practice various sports, in addition to being the scene of outdoor concerts. Among the favorite activities are surfing, frescobol, volleyball, soccer and footvolley. Cariocas and tourists usually sit on their sands at the end of the afternoon to chat and applaud the magnificent sunset. neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood located on the hillside of Corcovado, and next to Rodrigues de Freitas Lagoon, one of its characteristics and has a softer temperature than the average of the entire city. The neighborhood bears this name because of the vegetable garden and ecological reserve called Jardim Botanico.
Jardim Botanico is one of the quietest neighborhoods in the city of Rio de Janeiro and easy access to other neighborhoods in the South Zone, such as Gavea, Lagoa, Humaita, Leblon, Ipanema.
In addition to being known because of the Horto and Jardim Botanico, the neighborhood has among its points of attraction the Parque Lage, which and another ecological reserve, the nearby Rodrigues de Freitas Lagoon, many bars and restaurants that have stepped up in the neighborhood, having become a gastronomic hub.
For nature lovers, we have incredible trails that take the pups
of Primata, Horto and da Gruta.

neighborhood_overview: The Leblon neighborhood is one of the most charming and sophisticated in the city of Rio de Janeiro. The region is known for its paradisiacal beaches, fine-dining restaurants, bars, cafes and designer stores. The surroundings of the accommodation offer various leisure and entertainment options. One suggestion is to walk along the famous Leblon beach promenade and enjoy the most beautiful sunset in the city. Another option is to visit the Botanical Garden, one of the most beautiful tourist attractions in Rio de Janeiro. For those who like shopping, Shopping Leblon is an excellent option. The place has several national and international brand stores, as well as a large food court. The neighborhood is also known for its vibrant nightlife. There are several bars and nightclubs offering live music and a good selection of drinks. Laranjeiras is an absolutely pleasant neighborhood and ApÃª Laranjeiras is very close to almost anything. Largo do Machado Subway is 200m away. Copacabana is only two stations away, about 7 min by subway. Ipanema, 12 min.

Several supermarkets (100/200m), ItaÃº bike rental (at the front of the building), very cool restaurants are between 50 and 400m (galeto, japa, Peruvian and many speakeasies). Free market has two: between 100 and 500m.

Aterro do Flamengo, famous outdoor park, is a 7 min walk, about 300m. Guinle Park, ideal for the little ones (or for the big ones to relax), is next door, 50m.

Cristo Redentor is between 600/700m, a 20-minute walk down the main street of Laranjeiras.

At Carnival, Laranjeiras is a champion in the revelry: several street blocks (Giants of Lira, Laranjada, etc.) parade here. A very famous one, the âPress I chargeâ, goes out in the street ahead.

neighborhood_overview: The Leblon neighborhood is one of the most charming and sophisticated in the city of Rio de Janeiro. The region is known for its paradisiacal beaches, fine-dining restaurants, bars, cafes and designer stores. The surroundings of the accommodation offer various leisure and entertainment options. One suggestion is to walk along the famous Leblon beach promenade and enjoy the most beautiful sunset in the city. Another option is to visit the Botanical Garden, one of the most beautiful tourist attractions in Rio de Janeiro. For those who like shopping, Shopping Leblon is an excellent option. The place has several national and international brand stores, as well as a large food court. The neighborhood is also known for its vibrant nightlife. There are several bars and nightclubs offering live music and a good selection of drinks.
